physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bone scan revealed marked right thoracic spinal scoliosis and nonspecific focal uptake of technetium-99mâ€“labeled methylene diphosphonate within the right iliac crest and left distal radius, consistent with degenerative joint disease.
The patient had a serum PSA level of 17.2 ng per milliliter, elevated after prostatectomy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: PSA level was undetectable (<0.5 ng per milliliter) three months after prostatectomy but rose to 17.2 ng per milliliter during routine follow-up.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum PSA level declined to undetectable levels.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bone mineral density at the femoral neck was 0.72 g per square centimeter (T score -1.6) and at total hip was 0.94 g per square centimeter (T score -0.6).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: There was a 10% decline in bone mineral density at the femoral neck and total hip over the next 3 years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At the last follow-up, the serum PSA level was 50.6 ng per milliliter, indicating disease progression.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The serum PSA level was initially undetectable after treatment but markedly elevated upon follow-up, indicating disease recurrence.
